model_answer: A: A close-up of the brain model with an on-screen label “HYPOTHALAMIC SULCUS” pointing to the groove separating regions.

Answer: A: Thalamus
The speaker emphasizes the mammillothalamic tract connecting to the thalamus when explaining how sensory information travels to the brain. The thalamus is a key relay station in the brain that receives and processes sensory information before sending it to other parts of the brain for interpretation.
